720131f-a.text:
Grand Street, north side, west from (No. 550), but not including Lewis Street, showing the R. Hoe & Co. plant, between Columbia and Sheriff Streets. The 3-story house (No. 550) shown on the extreme right, is a frame structure with a brick front. The Hoe plant was demolished in 1930, and replaced by a modern apartment dwelling, as a slum clearance project.
April 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
720131f-a.folder: Grand Street & Lewis Street, Manhattan, NY

720907f-a.text:
Lewis Street, north from, but not including Grand Street. The Williamsburg Bridge is shown transversing the roof tops at Delancey Street.
February 12, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
720907f-a.folder: Lewis Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

720130f-a.text:
546-556 Grand Street, west of, adjoining, and at the N.W. corner of Lewis Street. No. 550 is a 3-story frame house with a brick front.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Mueeum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 301.
720130f-a.folder: Grand Street & Lewis Street, Manhattan, NY

of Grand Street. No. 2 is a 3-story frame house.
